posts.post_content: I don't usually rate cards based on what removal targets them, but considering the exorbitant mana cost and the fact that it can be [Shatter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Shatter)ed as well as [Doom Blade](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Doom Blade)d, it's worth mentioning. There are just too many ways to kill this card for it ever to be worthwhile.

posts.post_content: A 9/9 flyer for ![1](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=1&type=symbol)![White](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=W&type=symbol)![Blue](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=U&type=symbol)![Black](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=B&type=symbol)![Red](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=R&type=symbol)![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol) does compare favorably to more recent things like [Fusion Elemental](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fusion Elemental), but really it's main purpose is to abuse effects that look for converted mana costs; ie: [Torrent of Fire](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Torrent of Fire), [Erratic Explosion](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Erratic Explosion), [Hedron Matrix](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Hedron Matrix), etc.
posts.html:
A 9/9 flyer for does compare favorably to more recent things like Fusion Elemental, but really it's main purpose is to abuse effects that look for converted mana costs; ie: Torrent of Fire, Erratic Explosion, Hedron Matrix, etc.
